author: Mark Langshaw
title: Microsoft Band 2 trade-in programme gets you money off the new wearable - Tech
text: Microsoft has launched a trade-in programme for the Microsoft Band 2, helping it flog its new wearable and take rival products off the market in the process.Anyone with a first-generation Microsoft Band can recycle theirs to get £70 off its successor, but the promotion also applies to third-party fitness trackers. © Microsoft Fitbit wearables that cost more than £99 can be cashed in for a £50 discount, and any other smartwatch or tracker worth upwards of £89 can be traded in for £40 off.The Microsoft Band 2 sports an improved design with a curved AMOLED display and new features, including barometer support for measuring altitude.The trade-in programme applies to customers in the UK, where the new Band is priced at £199. More information is available on the Microsoft Store.The Microsoft Band 2 is set to ship by November 19.
